name: Sociolinguistics and Second Language Teaching and Learning
description: This course considers the impact on variant use by second language learners exerted by linguistic and extra-linguistic factors, such as the surrounding linguistic context, age, sex, style, and curricular and extra-curricular exposure. Implications are drawn for second language teaching, including deciding what registers and variants to teach and what activities to employ. [24L]
prerequisites: LIN256H5 (or permission from instructor), plus 0.5 credit in a 300-level LIN course.
